subject: Re: [junit] Re: Eclipse + Ant + JUnit
msgSnippet: ... The only thing I can suggest is changing Eclipse s Ant configuration to run the build in verbose and debug mode, then examine the logs carefully. Somehow,
messageBody:
Alistair A. Israel wrote:

> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Sean Dockery" <sdockery@s...> wrote:
> >
> > Could it have something to do with the version of ant? The version
> of ant
> > ships with Eclipse 3.0.0 is 1.6.1.
>
> Hey, Sean. Thanks, but nope. We're using an external Ant (1.6.2) and
> Eclipse is correctly pointed to it and all that.
>
> I still haven't investigated the <taskdef> angle, but another thing I
> just realized that our 'top-level' Ant build.xml actually has <ant...>
> tasks that call Ant on the 'inner' build.xml targets. Maybe that's
> what's causing the classpath issue under Eclipse.
>
> BTW, the most curious thing is the problem is still there even with my
> project's ${build} directory already _showing up_ in the classpath (I
> dump "java.class.path" within one of the tests that's failing). Strange.

The only thing I can suggest is changing Eclipse's Ant configuration to
run the build in verbose and debug mode, then examine the logs
carefully. Somehow, the classpath ain't what you expect!

Good luck.
